# *Loading R packages*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse,ggrepel, ggdist, ggridges,colorspace,ggthemes) 
```
:::


## *Importing data*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv",show_col_types = FALSE)
```
:::


## Plot as a probability density curve


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH))+ 
  geom_density(
    color='#1696d2',
    adjust=.65,
      alpha= .6
  )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## *Alternative design*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
median_eng <- median(exam_data$ENGLISH)
mean_eng <- mean(exam_data$ENGLISH)
std_eng <- sd(exam_data$ENGLISH)

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH))+ 
  geom_density(
    color='#1696d2',
    adjust=.65,
      alpha= .6
  )+
  stat_function(
    fun = dnorm,
    args = list(mean = mean_eng,
                sd=std_eng),
    col="grey30",
    size =.8)+
  geom_vline(
    aes(xintercept = mean_eng),
    colour="4d5887",
    linewidth=.6,
    linetype="dashed")+
  annotate(geom="text",
           x=mean_eng-8,
           y=0.04,
           label=paste0("Mean ENGLISH: ",
                        round((mean_eng),2)))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
